pageContext.description: Cutting edge much worn a quite blunt; three projecting ribs on each face; prominent mould marks along each side; butt end of socket slightly broken.
pageContext.patina: Greena and brown patina, with rather tinny look on surface.
pageContext.associations: Part of a large hoard; see card for first socketed celt.
pageContext.publications: Arch. Journ. XXX 279,Evans,Archaeology of Kent (Jessup), 107,Journ. Anthrop. Inst. III, 230.
pageContext.site: England,Kent,Saltwood,Hayne Wood, on line of railway cutting, 6 ft. below surface, lying on stratum of sand, c. 25 yards NE by N of summit of hill. Found June 4, 1872.
pageContext.toSearch: Saltwood, Hythe, Hythe, Kent Ct21, UK
